Articles.Content:
I'm sure this has been discovered, but... Related to my other thread about new orbiting techniques...

I launched a little Stayputnik with solar panels and some batteries just to practice getting into orbit.

I thought I was there, but realized I messed up and ran out of fuel. Seeing that my path took me back to the surface, I figured, hey, I'll watch it burn up.

However, with panels extended from space, the craft slowed enough so that it never heated up.

: )

Is this a bug?
Lol, it acts as a wing for you to glide all the way down. Kind of make sense.
That's not gliding... that's falling with style!

Is this a bug?

You are asking the wrong question.

The right question is: "How can I eploit this?"
